item.title: Paul add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "[Horror fiction] shows us that the control we believe we have is purely illusory, and that every moment we teeter on chaos and oblivion." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Paul add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "To call you excrement would be an insult to the product of my bowels." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Paul add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Paul add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Paul add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Paul add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Paul add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Paul add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "At the time, my life just seemed too complete, and maybe we have to break everything to make something better out of ourselves." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Paul add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Our real discoveries come from chaos, from going to the place that looks wrong and stupid and foolish." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last it and not be smashed by it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Paul add a quote by Hemingway, Ernest
item.description: "I drink to make other people more interesting." -- Hemingway, Ernest

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The hard part about writing a novel is finishing it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "You only live twice: Once when you're born And once when you look death in the face." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Mr Bond, they have a saying in Chicago: 'Once is happenstance. Twice is coincidence. The third time it's enemy action'." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Paul add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Surround yourself with human beings, my dear James. They are easier to fight for than principles." -- Ian Fleming

item.title: Paul add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Paul add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Paul add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Now the standard cure for one who is sunk is to consider those in actual destitution or physical suffering—this is an all-weather beatitude for gloom in general and fairly salutary day-time advice for everyone. But at three o’clock in the morning, a forgotten package has the same tragic importance as a death sentence, and the cure doesn’t work—and in a real dark night of the soul it is always three o’clock in the morning, day after day." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Paul add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Paul add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Some may never live, but the crazy never die." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Paul add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "When the going gets weird, the weird turn professional." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Paul add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "It never got weird enough for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Paul add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "It's better to die laughing than to live each moment in fear." -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Paul add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "Books aren't written - they're rewritten. Including your own. It is one of the hardest things to accept, especially after the seventh rewrite hasn't quite done it." -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Paul add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Life has become immeasurably better since I have been forced to stop taking it seriously." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Paul add a quote by Roger Ebert
item.description: "Of what use is freedom of speech to those who fear to offend?" -- Roger Ebert
